info.title: STROMDAO EAF

meterId.description: Uniq ID of meter to be updated. Might be MeLoId

time.description: Timestamp of meter reading given in partameter `reading` in UTC ms.

reading.description: Actual reading in Wh at given time in parameter `time`

concentratorId.description: ConcentratorId to authorize wildcard reading updates for

meterId.description: Meter ID - if omitted all meters will be taken

fromTime.description: Valid from time (will be converted to epoch number)

*.summary:
Statistical Load Profile of all or specific meter for a timeframe.
            (loadprofile.load)
            [autoAlias]
*.description: Returns array of epochs with its consumption and total consumption in timeframe of given meterId or all if no meterId is given.

*.summary:
Simple machine learing based prediction of next epochs consumption
            (prediction.x_epochs)
            [autoAlias]
*.description: The method operates by examining the consumption history of a meter during past epochs. An epoch in this context is defined as a distinct period during which energy consumption is measured and associated with a dynamic tariff. By assessing how much electricity was consumed during these previous intervals, the method constructs a model to forecast future usage. Limitation: Requires a sequence of readings without gaps.

post.summary:
Distribution of consumption in a time period to tariff segments.
            (settlement.retrieve)
            [autoAlias]

virtual_1.description: Part of consumption in virtual_1 tariff

virtual_2.description: Part of consumption in virtual_2 tariff

virtual_3.description: Part of consumption in virtual_3 tariff

virtual_4.description: Part of consumption in virtual_4 tariff

virtual_5.description: Part of consumption in virtual_5 tariff

virtual_6.description: Part of consumption in virtual_6 tariff

virtual_7.description: Part of consumption in virtual_7 tariff

virtual_8.description: Part of consumption in virtual_8 tariff

virtual_9.description: Part of consumption in virtual_9 tariff

post.description: The settlement.retrieve action is designed for calculating how a consumption figure, measured between two meter readings, is divided across different tariff segments. It uses a given timeframe and the consumption amount as input parameters. The result of this action details the split of the consumption into designated tariff segments, labeled `virtual_1` to `virtual_9`. This action serves as a central point of calculation to allocate energy usage to the respective tariff sub-meters according to the defined tariff structure.

get.summary:
Provides user-defined labels for instance-specific tariff segments
            (tariff.customLabels)
            [autoAlias]

200.description: Mapping of internal label like `virtual_1` to runtime specific label like `off-peak`. Static response as it is taken from the `runtime.settings.js`.

get.description: The customLabels action related to tariffs provides custom labels for the tariff segments in an instance.These are mapped to correspond with the specific use case, such as representing tariffs like `peak` and `off-peak`.The internal identifiers range from `virtual_1` to `virtual_9` and are configured accordingly.The configuration is done in the `runtime.settings.js` file and should be set before the initial start of the framework;it is not intended to be changed during runtime

get.summary:
Gives setup price infos of current environment.
            (tariff.getPrices)
            [autoAlias]

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: Epoch to get price information for.

post.summary:
Specify kWh price per tariff segment.
            (tariff.setPrices)
            [autoAlias]

200.description: Price Information as given in request

post.description: The setPrices action allows setting a price per kilowatt-hour for each tariff segment within this environment for energy applications. You can retrieve the available tariff segments through the `tariff.customLabels` action. When setting prices, a price must be specified for each tariff segment using the internal labels `virtual_1` to `virtual_9`. Additionally, an optional time slice (epoch) can be provided to indicate from when the price information becomes valid
